metadata.title: CVE-2022-4285 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An illegal memory access flaw was found in the binutils package. Parsing anELF file containing corrupt symbol version information may result in adenial of service. This issue is the result of an incomplete fix forCVE-2020-16599.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4285` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdb - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5+esm1
gdb-multiarch - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5+esm1
gdb-source - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5+esm1
gdb64 - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5+esm1
gdbserver - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils-avr package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
gdb package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5+esm1').
